title.native: 爆丸バトルブローラーズ

description: The Bakugan battle brawlers began when two young boys by the name of Dan and Shun made the rules to a mysterious game played with bakupearls, gate cards and ability cards. No one would ever have guessed what was going to happen next as Dan and his new internet friends battle their way to the bitter end.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Website](http://psychiclover.net)

Psychic Lover (サイキックラバー) is a J-pop band consisting of vocalist YOFFY (Yoshiyuki Wada / 和田よしゆき) and guitarist [IMAJO](https://anilist.co/staff/357213) (Tatsuhiro Imajo / 今城龍寛). Originally consisting of six members, YOFFY and IMAJO are the only two who remained for their rise to fame. Much of their work has been featured as opening and closing themes of Japanese television series and anime. YOFFY has also worked with Eizo Sakamoto (vocalist of [Anthem](https://anilist.co/staff/191547/) and Animetal), [Masaaki Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/101528/), [Sakura Nogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95204/), [Ai Tokunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95324), [Ryouko Shintani](https://anilist.co/staff/95315/), [Mayumi Gojou](https://anilist.co/staff/107007/), [Sister MAYO](https://anilist.co/staff/345387/), and [Yukari Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/95359/) on other projects.

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.
Karl Willems is known as a voice director for many of Ocean's productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2876412506)

Representative director of [Felix Film](https://anilist.co/studio/6126/). Adept in animation and composite work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2876412506)

Representative director of [Felix Film](https://anilist.co/studio/6126/). Adept in animation and composite work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2876412506)

Representative director of [Felix Film](https://anilist.co/studio/6126/). Adept in animation and composite work.
Terry Klassen is a Canadian voice actor and voice director.

Voice actress and dubbing director at Iyuno Poland, TransPerfect Media Poland and Film Factory Studio.

Wife of [Krzysztof Cybiński](https://anilist.co/staff/218965/Krzysztof-Cybiski). Mother of [Kacper](https://anilist.co/staff/310060) and [Olga](https://anilist.co/staff/318554) .
Participated in the shows "The Voice of Poland", "The Voice of Switzerland", "Must Be The Music - Tylko Muzyka" and "Szansa na Sukces".
